DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the trial is to determine whether robot assisted laparoscopic hysterectomy compared with abdominal hysterectomy in a fast track program gives a faster recovery postoperatively, causes less tissue damage and less effects on the immunological system, and is health economically cost-effective.
DOC.brief_title: Robot Assisted Laparoscopic Hysterectomy vs. Abdominal Hysterectomy in Endometrial Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: If detailed description is requested, please contact sponsor.
DOC.criteria: Over 18 years of age. Scheduled to total hysterectomy + bilateral salpingooophorectomy (BSAE) and peritoneal lavage because of endometrial carcinoma, International federation of gynecology and obstetrics (FIGO) stage 1, grade 1 and 2, with diploid DNA profile (i.e. low risk profile). WHO performance status â‰¤ 2. Proficiency in Swedish Accept to participate in the study and has signed written informed consent document. The operation should be considered possible to be perform laparoscopically and by laparotomy through a low transverse abdominal wall incision. The operation is anticipated to comprise more than the hysterectomy + BSAE. A midline incision is planned for the laparotomy. Contraindications towards spinal anesthesia with intrathecally applied morphine. Physically disabled women who cannot be expected to be mobilized in accordance to the fast track program in a way similar to what is expected from notphysically disabled women. Mentally disabled women who cannot fill in the questionnaires or understand the consequences of participating in a trial. Severe psychiatric disease or on medication for psychiatric disease so that the physician consider participation in the trial inappropriate.
